metadata.title: Seborrheic Dermatitis Database - Part 2: Scientific Analysis & Mechanisms
metadata.description: Deep mechanistic analysis of how ingredients worsen SD, ingredient interactions, risk severity scoring, and research-backed pathways
metadata.note: This is PART 2 of 3. For ingredients list, see Part 1. For practical applications, see Part 3.

malassezia_biology.section_description: Understanding Malassezia as the primary pathogenic driver in SD

key_organisms.name: Malassezia furfur
key_organisms.lipid_requirement: Obligate lipophile - requires exogenous lipids for growth

lipase_enzyme_specificity.description: Malassezia lipases target specific fatty acid chain lengths
lipase_enzyme_specificity.km_values: Malassezia lipase Km ~5mM for C12-C18 fatty acids (high affinity)
lipase_enzyme_specificity.vmax_values: Maximum velocity fastest for C12-C14 (lauric/myristic acids)
lipase_enzyme_specificity.mechanism: Pancreatic lipase-like serine esterase with specificity for mid-chain C12-C18

products.name: Free Fatty Acids (FFAs)
products.source: Lipase hydrolysis of triglycerides and esters
products.inflammatory_effect: Direct TLR2/TLR4 activation → pro-inflammatory cytokine storm
products.concentration_effect: Even 0.1-1 mM FFAs trigger keratinocyte IL-6, IL-8 production 300-500%

products.name: Lipid Peroxides
products.source: Oxidation of unsaturated FFAs (oleic, linoleic) on scalp
products.skin_penetration: Lipid peroxides penetrate stratum corneum; trigger deeper inflammation

products.name: Malassezia-Derived Allergens (MDA)
products.effect: IgE-mediated hypersensitivity; amplify Th2 immune response

barrier_dysfunction_mechanisms.section_description: How ingredients damage the skin barrier, promoting Malassezia colonization

barrier_damage_pathways.mechanism: Protein denaturant + lipid solubilizer; removes 30-40% skin lipids per wash
barrier_damage_pathways.inflammatory_cascade: IL-1α release → increased permeability → ingredient penetration

barrier_damage_pathways.mechanism: Osmotic gradient draws water from stratum corneum
barrier_damage_pathways.malassezia_effect: Dehydrated barrier = favors anaerobic yeast growth

barrier_damage_pathways.mechanism: Forms impermeable barrier; traps heat, sweat, sebum
barrier_damage_pathways.malassezia_consequence: Ideal conditions for exponential yeast growth (doubling time 2-4 hours)

barrier_damage_pathways.mechanism: EDTA chelates Ca2+ → destabilizes lipid lamellae; High pH disrupts lipid organization
barrier_damage_pathways.malassezia_opportunity: Enhanced penetration of fatty acids into viable epidermis

tight_junction_disruption.description: Ingredients damage claudins and zonula occludens (ZO-1) proteins
tight_junction_disruption.consequence: Increased paracellular permeability → food allergen translocation
tight_junction_disruption.malassezia_effect: Immune dysregulation through cross-reactive epitope exposure

immune_phenotype.th1_profile: IL-2, IFN-γ (typically normal or slightly elevated)
immune_phenotype.th17_profile: IL-17, IL-22, IL-23 (severely elevated - KEY PROBLEM)
immune_phenotype.treg_profile: IL-10, TGF-β (depleted - loss of immune tolerance)

aryl_hydrocarbon_receptor_ahr.role: Master regulator of skin barrier and immune homeostasis
aryl_hydrocarbon_receptor_ahr.sd_pathology: Excessive AhR signaling in Malassezia-infected skin
consequences: Loss of IL-10 regulation → uncontrolled inflammation
aryl_hydrocarbon_receptor_ahr.ingredient_effect: Galactomyces ferments amplify AhR signaling → worse inflammation

cytokine_cascade.primary_response: TLR2/TLR4 activation on keratinocytes + antigen-presenting cells
cytokine_cascade.secondary_response: IL-17, IL-22, IL-23 production via T-cell activation
cytokine_cascade.chronic_state: Persistent Th17 dominance; loss of Treg suppression

ingredient_interaction_matrix.section_description: How combinations of problematic ingredients create synergistic damage

synergy_examples.mechanism: SLS strips lipids; PG enhances penetration of remaining irritants + any contaminated ingredients
synergy_examples.outcome: Barrier damage 5-8x worse than SLS alone

synergy_examples.mechanism: Lauric acid feeds Malassezia; Galactomyces stimulates immune dysregulation → amplified inflammation
synergy_examples.outcome: Severe flare within 12-24 hours; flare lasting 10-21 days

synergy_examples.mechanism: Triple occlusion; anaerobic microenvironment; Malassezia exponential growth
synergy_examples.outcome: Thick biofilm formation; yeast concentration 1000x normal

synergy_examples.mechanism: Barrier disruption (alcohol) + oxidative stress (fragrance + EO allergen generation) + penetration enhancement

synergy_examples.combination: Sodium Chloride + Propylene Glycol + Synthetic Fragrance
synergy_examples.mechanism: Osmotic dehydration + penetration enhancement + allergen generation

risk_severity_scoring_system.section_description: Unified scoring system for rapid ingredient safety assessment

scoring_method.concentration_multiplier: Adjust based on typical product concentration (0.1x to 3x)

score_interpretation.0-20: SAFE - Low risk; generally acceptable for SD
score_interpretation.21-40: CAUTION - Moderate risk; patch test before use; avoid in flare
score_interpretation.41-60: HIGH RISK - Significant concern; not recommended; flare likely
score_interpretation.61-80: CRITICAL - Severe reaction expected; avoid entirely
score_interpretation.81-100: EXTREME CRITICAL - Guaranteed severe flare; never use

examples.malassezia_score: 15 (not Malassezia nutrient directly, but strips protective lipids)

fatty_acid_metabolism_deep_dive.section_description: Detailed biochemistry of how Malassezia utilizes fatty acids

lipase_kinetics.vmax: Varies by species; highest for M. globosa

hydrolysis_pathways.ffa_concentration: Can reach 10-50 mM locally on scalp

hydrolysis_pathways.concern: FFA released in active zones; alcohol component added irritant

hydrolysis_pathways.severity: SELF-SUSTAINING - Yeast destroys barrier lipids while feeding

beta_oxidation.description: Malassezia β-oxidizes FFAs for energy and growth
beta_oxidation.process: Fatty acid → Acetyl-CoA (energy) + Shorter chain FFA
beta_oxidation.iterative_release: Each round of oxidation releases smaller FFAs
beta_oxidation.problem: Released FFAs still inflammatory; cascade of smaller irritants

lipid_peroxidation_cascade.section_description: How unsaturated fatty acids become toxic oxidized products

oxidation_products.name: Lipid Hydroperoxides
oxidation_products.formation: Primary oxidation product from ROS attack
oxidation_products.penetration: More lipophilic than parent fatty acid; deeper skin penetration

oxidation_products.name: Aldehydes (Malondialdehyde, 4-HNE)
oxidation_products.effect: Protein cross-linking; keratinocyte damage; apoptosis induction
oxidation_products.systemic_effect: Biomarker of oxidative stress throughout body

studies.citation: Prohic et al. (2016) - Malassezia and SD
studies.finding: Malassezia lipase preferentially metabolizes C12-C18 fatty acids
studies.implication: Fatty acid chain length is deterministic for Malassezia growth

studies.citation: Akaza et al. (2012) - Oleic acid and SD
studies.finding: Oleic acid exposure increases IL-6, IL-8, TNF-α 300-500%
studies.implication: Unsaturated C18 more inflammatory than saturated

studies.citation: Gupta et al. (2004) - Malassezia and AhR
studies.finding: Malassezia metabolites activate AhR in keratinocytes

studies.implication: Both must be addressed for effective treatment

studies.citation: Ceilley & Swinyer (2004) - Scalp pH and SD
studies.implication: pH 5.0-5.5 maintenance critical for SD management
